page.title: 15The Harvest Festival
page.content: On Sunday I was feeling very excited because it was the Harvest Festival at Ingram Church. But in another way I felt sad because it was Canon Hay's last service. He was retiring. When I went into the church it was packed. I could smell the fruit and vegetables and I could see all our brightly coloured Harvest pictures up on the stone walls. I put on my choir robe. We had about three hymns. Then the children from our school came out to the front. We sang Stand Up Clap Hands Shout Thankyou Lordand said Harvest Poems. The little ones sang Oats and Beans and Barley Grow. We walked slowly back to our places. After the service everyone went into the hall. The tea was spread out on long tables. We gave gifts to Canon Hay.
